intro: Sinosenecio jishouensis, commonly known as the Jishou sineweed, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers. The plant is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and small, clustered yellow flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
